meanings.definition: To exchange or trade something with another person.
meanings.sent1: We were swapping stickers at school.
meanings.sent2: The kids were swapping toys during recess.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were swapping stories about their day.
meanings.sent4: The birds were swapping places on the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The friends were swapping secrets under the oak tree.

meanings.definition: The act of switching or trading places with someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The swapping of seats in class caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: The swapping of roles in the play made it interesting.
meanings.sent3: The swapping of hats between the clowns was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The swapping of colors in the painting created a unique effect.
meanings.sent5: The swapping of positions in the game kept everyone on their toes.
